eu.trentorise.opendata.semtext

Class SemTexts

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.trentorise.opendata.semtext.SemTexts

extends Object
    Utilities toolbox for semtexts.
    Author:
    David Leoni

        Tolerance for probabilities
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • disambiguate

        @Nullable
public static Meaning disambiguate(Iterable<Meaning> meanings)
        Determines the best meaning among the given ones according to their probabilities. If no best meaning is found null is returned.
        Parameters:
        meanings - a list of meanings.
        Returns:
        the disambiguated meaning or null if no meaning can be clearly identified.

      • checkMeaningStatus

        public static void checkMeaningStatus(@Nullable
                      MeaningStatus meaningStatus,
                      @Nullable
                      Meaning selectedMeaning,
                      @Nullable
                      Object prependedErrorMessage)
        Checks that the provided couple meaning status / selected meaning is valid. For SELECTED and REVIEWED statuses there must be a selectedMeaning with valid id, while TO_DISAMBIGUATE and NOT_SURE statuses must have a null selectedMeaning.
        Parameters:
        prependedErrorMessage - the exception message to use if the check fails; will be converted to a string using String.valueOf(Object) and prepended to more specific error messages.
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - on invalid meaning status / selectedMeaning couple

      • checkPositiveScore

        public static double checkPositiveScore(double score,
                        @Nullable
                        Object prependedErrorMessage)
        Checks whether provided score has tolerance above -TOLERANCE
        Parameters:
        prependedErrorMessage - the exception message to use if the check fails; will be converted to a string using String.valueOf(Object) and prepended to more specific error messages.
        Returns:
        the provided score if positive within tolerance
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - on invalid score

      • checkScore

        public static void checkScore(double score,
              @Nullable
              Object prependedErrorMessage)
        Checks the provided score is within valid bounds.
        Parameters:
        score - must be between -TOLERANCE ≤ score ≤ 1 + TOLERANCE
        prependedErrorMessage - the exception message to use if the check fails; will be converted to a string using String.valueOf(Object) and prepended to more specific error messages.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - on invalid score

      • checkSpan

        public static void checkSpan(int startOffset,
             int endOffset,
             @Nullable
             Object prependedErrorMessage)
        Checks provided offsets represent a valid span. startOffset must be less or equal than endOffset and they must be both greater or equal than 0
        Parameters:
        prependedErrorMessage - the exception message to use if the check fails; will be converted to a string using String.valueOf(Object) and prepended to more specific error messages.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - on invalid span.

      • checkSpans

        public static void checkSpans(Iterable<? extends Span> spans,
              int leftOffset,
              int rightOffset,
              @Nullable
              Object prependedErrorMessage)
        Checks spans are all be valid spans (see checkSpan(int, int, Object) and are non-overlapping (a span end offset may coincide with next span start offset). Spans must be contained within leftOffset and rightOffset (last span end offset may coincide with rightOffset).
        Parameters:
        prependedErrorMessage - the exception message to use if the check fails; will be converted to a string using String.valueOf(Object) and prepended to more specific error messages.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - on invalid spans

      • semTextsToDict

        public static eu.trentorise.opendata.commons.Dict semTextsToDict(Iterable<SemText> semTexts)
        Creates a Dict out of the provided semantic texts.

      • dictToSemTexts

        public static com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList<SemText> dictToSemTexts(eu.trentorise.opendata.commons.Dict dict)
        Returns the provided dictionary as an immutable list of semantic texts

      • mergeMeanings

        public static com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList<Meaning> mergeMeanings(Iterable<Meaning> oldMeanings,
                                                             Iterable<Meaning> newMeanings)
        A new immutable list of sorted meanings is returned with the provided meanings merged to the existing ones. The first one has highest prob and probabilities are normalized so they sum up to 1.0. If a new meaning equals an existing meaning it will replace it.

      • spanToRange

        public static com.google.common.collect.Range spanToRange(Span span)
        Converts provided span to a Guava Range of the [start, end) form.

      • spanEqual

        public static boolean spanEqual(@Nullable
                Span span1,
                @Nullable
                Span span2)
        Returns whether the two provided spans have equal boundaries.
